title: Why Is Riot Nerfing Aurelion Sol Out of the Blue?
body: Why are they nerfing a pretty underpowered champion to the ground, I don't get it.

replies.body: Because we believe he's overpowered and that that will be an issue we need to act on before patch 6.8. We're nerfing him in 6.7 as a result, because we feel he'll be a clear issue soon even if that's not widely visible yet.

I dont want to sound snarky but i find it a bit ironic that you were so fast with Aurelion when Lucian dominates soloQ and pro play since day 1 of the preseason and you dont seem to bother much (except if you believe that the 200 range nerf to his ulti was actually meaningful)
It's ok, if anyone took Riot's idea of balance seriously anyway they'd not say anything about it and just calmly play *another game*
*cough* *cough* Blade and Soul

There's a difference between champions being owerpowered and champions being popular. 
Also, Riot is preparing for Playoffs, so they might not ignore non-challenger/pro people  that want someone buffed or nerfed, they might just have a hard time integrating  it to fit the balancing at Playoffs.

to be fair {{champion:202}} is pretty fucking powerful as is.... and thats after a month of him being around the rift and people find how strong he is...
Aurelion is a straight forward champ to be honest, which lowers the skill and makes him fairly strong for some effort. His passive and w being really the only odd thing but 1 spell to test with... Q E and R are straightforward and not difficult compared to a lot of champs, and I LIKE THIS. A small new mechanic and existing things instead of every ability trying to do something new... {{champion:203}} {{champion:432}} cough.
I personally love new mechanics, though sometimes they might not turn out the best (Skarner), at least it tells us, that Riot might be trying to renew the game.

I am fine with it as long as it doesn't interfere with the game itself. {{champion:432}} is fine, but he should be getting chimes to maximize his usefulness, {{champion:72}} game you kinda need them to be effective in areas...{{champion:203}} double edged sword passive... it makes you forced to play one way or be meh.... why pick {{champion:72}} when {{champion:254}} can do most of what he does, same snowballing tendency and doesn't give free gold/vision with passive...
I like it when devs try to renew the game, but when they seem to cater the metas to these new mechanics, it makes me cringe...
Hes not really underpowered, he just has very large weaknesses that can be exploited. He actually is quite potent when not hard countered.

I'm not going to say I understand balance issues better than anyone else; but with how Aurelion fares when you know ANYTHING about how to counter him, I can't say I understand nerfing him either.

having played with and against him a few times, and playing him myself, I will say his damage is rather high, and his CC amount is fairly over the average, however if anyone gets within his passive... he dies, flashes, or ults, nothing else really.  if his flash or ult is on cooldown, tough luck he dies.

that being said, his ult is rather powerful I suppose, so I could possibly see a nerf... but realistically, I think he's a good example of a balanced design and power level that is getting nerfed too quickly to the point that I really just don't want to even bother putting more time into learning him.


Then this in comparison to the constant Lucian picks, and various other champions that have few or no counterable strategies besides a few specific champions (that if they simply wait till last pick you lose by default) makes me question Riot's decisions on balancing, but I do understand it's a precarious situation with how many champs exist.
Because they're fucking morons and have no idea what they're doing.

If they are nerfing Aurelion Sol, it means that either he currently is over-performing than intended in multiple different circumstances and situations, and/or if he will be over-performing with other changes/update that are also going to come out in the following patches.

Riot test things out in Beta first before they become official, so just slowdown a bit before going on a rant saying he is going to be "nerfed to the ground" before it even becomes official.
